senses.de: to control the way a machine, system, or process works.
senses.ex: She learned how to operate a computer.

Tips.title: Machine Interaction
Tips.description: Refers to handling devices, requires knowledge of specific operations.
Tips.example: I need to learn how to operate the new coffee machine.

Tips.title: Active Control
Tips.description: Implies active involvement, not just turning something on.
Tips.example: The technician operates the soundboard at the concert.

senses.de: to be working or functioning, especially in a particular way.
senses.ex: The television station operates 24 hours a day.

Tips.title: Functionality Status
Tips.description: Used when something functions correctly without issues.
Tips.example: The air conditioning is now operating without any strange noises.

Tips.title: Continuous Action
Tips.description: Can describe something that works non-stop or around the clock.
Tips.example: Emergency services operate all day, every day.

senses.de: in business, to buy and sell goods or services.

Tips.title: Business Activity
Tips.description: Specifies the regions or sectors where a business is active.
Tips.example: Our store operates both online and offline.

Tips.title: Economic Presence
Tips.description: Indicates active engagement in commerce within a specific area.
Tips.example: The bank operates mainly in urban areas.

senses.ex: The surgeon will operate on him tomorrow.

Tips.title: Medical Procedures
Tips.description: Specific to performing surgical procedures in medicine.
Tips.example: Only licensed doctors are allowed to operate in this hospital.

Tips.title: Surgical Context
Tips.description: Often associated with urgency or life-saving in medical scenarios.
Tips.example: Due to the accident, the doctors had to operate immediately.

Conduct.wordDefinition:
Conduct generally means to organize, plan, or carry out a particular activity or event. For example, a symphony conductor conducts the orchestra, or a teacher conducts a class.

So, while conduct is generally used in the context of organizing, managing or leading a group or event, operate is more commonly used to refer to the functioning or control of a machine, system or a physical process.

Control.wordDefinition:
Control refers to the ability to regulate or manage something, while operate refers to the act of performing or using something.

For example, a car has both control and operate components. The driver controls the car by managing the steering wheel, brakes, and accelerator pedal.

Control is applied to the management or regulation of a system or process, whereas operate is applied to the use or performance of a tool or machine.

Function.wordDefinition:
Function refers to the purpose or role something serves, while operate refers to the action of using or working something.

Function is applicable when describing what something was designed to do, such as a computer's function of processing data or a soccer ball's function of being kicked around.

In essence, function refers to a thing's purpose or intent, while operate refers to the action of using or working it.

Manage.wordDefinition:
Manage refers to the act of controlling or directing something in order to achieve a desired outcome. This can be applied to things like businesses, teams, projects, or even personal finances.

Essentially, managing involves making decisions and taking actions that lead to success and positive results.

In summary, managing is about control and direction, while operating is about carrying out specific tasks. Both are important skills in different contexts, but they require different types of expertise and knowledge.

Manoeuvre.wordDefinition:
Manoeuvre usually refers to a movement that requires skill or careful planning. It often involves avoiding obstacles or changing direction quickly.

For example, a pilot might have to manoeuvre the plane around a storm, or a basketball player might have to manoeuvre around defenders to get to the basket.

Manoeuvre implies a more dynamic and skillful action, while operate implies a more routine and technical action.

Perform.wordDefinition:
Both operate and perform refer to carrying out a task or activity, but the context and specific meaning can differ.

Perform can be used more broadly, and often refers to carrying out a task or activity successfully or skillfully. For instance, a musician might perform a song on stage, an athlete might perform well in a game or a surgeon might perform a procedure with precision.

Operate refers more so to using specific equipment or systems while perform has a broader range of applications and can relate to achieving a goal or displaying a skill.

Run.wordDefinition:
Run refers to the action of functioning and executing a task or process. It is a more general term and is often used to describe the practical and functional aspect of an object.

For example, a car runs on gasoline, a business runs smoothly when it is well-managed, a school runs classes and educational programs.

Operate is more specific for technical and mechanical control while run is more general for executing tasks and functions.

Work.wordDefinition:
Work refers to the action of performing a task, job or function that produces a result or benefit. For example, a teacher works to educate students, an artist works to create art, a cashier works to handle transactions.

In short, one can operate a machine or system, but they work to achieve some outcome.

quotes.Text: The responsibility for good government lies not just with governments themselves but also with every other part of the system they operate in, including media, non-governmental organisations and the public.
quotes.Title: English Educator
quotes.Name: Geoff Mulgan

quotes.Text: I pray before I go into the operating room for every case, and I ask him to give me wisdom, to help me to know what to do - and not only for operating, but for everything.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: Maybe we can show government how to operate better as a result of better architecture. Eventually, I think Chicago will be the most beautiful great city left in the world.
quotes.Title: American Architect
quotes.Name: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.Text: I believe everyone should have a broad picture of how the universe operates and our place in it. It is a basic human desire. And it also puts our worries in perspective.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: I never think of myself as wise. I think of myself as possessing a critical intelligence which I intend to allow to operate.
quotes.Title: English Dramatist
quotes.Name: Harold Pinter

quotes.Text: Obviously I've spent most of my working life with men and they have this way of operating which seems a bit alien to me.
quotes.Title: British Journalist
quotes.Name: Janet Street-Porter

quotes.Text: Our concept is not that America should operate alone or by itself in world affairs or in military affairs.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Douglas Feith

quotes.Text: I'll be honest: 'Badlands' changed my life: it really did rewire my brain as to how film can operate.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Jeff Nichols

quotes.Text: The system under which we live is owned and operated by people who do not deserve to run the world.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Tom Morello

quotes.Text: I've operated and launched newspapers all over the world.
quotes.Title: American Publisher
quotes.Name: Rupert Murdoch
